title: The Altar and Courtyard
summary: Exodus 27 outlines the construction of the bronze altar for burnt offerings and the design of the tabernacle courtyard. It also introduces the oil for the lamp, which must burn continually.

faq.question: What was the bronze altar used for?
faq.answer: For making burnt offerings to the Lord as part of Israelâ€™s worship and atonement.

faq.question: What command did God give about the tabernacle lamp?
faq.answer: It was to burn continually, maintained by the priests using pure olive oil.
